subject: README: add config via D-Bus
commitMessage:
README: add config via D-Bus

We can now add a virtual sensor in two ways (reading in a JSON file or a
configuration from D-Bus), so add this information into the README.

Signed-off-by: Rashmica Gupta <rashmica.g@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I63099953a5fdd3c860a728036544955f906a31f7

Change has been successfully merged by Patrick Williams

Maybe also mention that if it's configured via D-Bus/entity-manager then it only supports the modified median expression?  Don't want to give people false hope that they can put exprk in entity-manager ;)
Ack
Can we give a little more detail on why?
Ack

I thought all of these are supported:
http://www.partow.net/programming/exprtk/

I have used "Expression": "44330.0 * (1.0 - ((P0/101325.0) ^ (1/5.255)))"
and seems to work fine.

The current way to add a virtual sensor is a standalone JSON config file like the one in your patch. phosphor-virtual-sensor reads in this file directly. Sensors added this way can use arbitrary expressions.

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-virtual-sensor/+/43482 adds in being able to get a virtual sensor config from D-Bus (the config info is added in Entity Manager which publishes it onto D-Bus). Ed had concerns about taking an arbitrary expression from D-Bus, and so sensors added this way are restricted as to what calculations they can use.

I'll try to make this clearer in the README.
Thank you!
I think the ``` may need to be on its own line to render correctly.
Ack

Prefer something like:

> README: add config via d-bus

You want the 'git log --oneline' to be more useful to help casual readers trying to figure out where a problem might have been introduced.
Makes sense.
Can we point to the file?  `virtual_sensor_config.json`, I think.
Ack

Can you expand on this slightly?  I think you're saying to insert a sensor with these additional 'Desc' fields, but the wording makes it sound like you could just create a JSON with these blob.

Where are 'Type's defined?  Can you document them as well?
Ack
It isn't obvious to me what this is referring to.
Does the latest commit make it more obvious?
Can we open an issue to get these changed to real strings down the road?  I think we've discussed that already but it also requires changes in dbus-sensors.
Done
